page.title: 03PLANT LIFE.
page.content: This is an area of interesting plant life.It is the southern limit of northern plants & the northern limit of southern plants & so plants from the two areas overlap.Many conifers have been planted around the reservoirs.There are some decidous trees such as oak,ash,sycamore,silver birch,chestnut & willow.On the moors apart from the bracken & heather,gorse can be found & bilberries grow.These are picked by many people to make puddings & pies.Many wild flowers still grow here_foxgloves,campion, tormentil,coltsfoot,wood anemonies, vetch,violets & wild pansies.In the wetter areas of bog there are primitive plants studied by leading biologists.The stone walls are covered with colonies of various lichen.
